bio:treatment.description: Plants sparsely to moderately pubescent, fruits glabrous. Stems (1.4–)2.5–7.5(–9) dm. Basal leaves shortly petiolate; blade oblanceolate to oblong, 2–7.5 cm × 5–20 mm. Cauline leaves: blade lanceolate, narrowly oblong, or linear-lanceolate, (1.5–)2.5–7(–9) cm × (2–)3–15(–25) mm, apex acute or acuminate, surfaces sparsely pubescent, trichomes mostly forked. Fruiting pedicels straight or slightly curved upwards, (4–)6–10(–14) mm. Flowers: sepals 1.5–1.7 × 0.5–0.7(–1) mm; petals 2–2.5 × 0.5–0.7(–1) mm; filaments 1.5–2 mm; anthers 0.2–0.4 mm. Fruits (1.7–)2–2.2 × (2–)2.2–2.5 mm; style slender, 0.5–0.9 mm. Seeds 1.2–1.4 × 1–1.1 mm. 2n = 14.
Fields, grassy mountain slopes, plains, roadsides, cultivated fields;

introduced; Alta., B.C., Man., N.B., Nfld. and Labr. (Nfld.), N.W.T., N.S., Ont., Que., Yukon; Alaska, Conn., Ind., Maine, Mass., Mich., Minn., Mont., N.H., Ohio, Pa., Vt.; Europe; Asia; n Africa; introduced also in South America (Argentina), Australia.
